Etymon pt-PT Note: Borrowed from Portuguese (Dalgado); Borrowed from Classical Persian آچار (āčār) (Wiktionary).
Borrowed from Portuguese (Dalgado); Borrowed from Urdu اَلْماری ( almārī ) (Wiktionary).
Borrowed from Hindustani बपतिस्मा ( baptismā ) / بَپْتِسْمَہ ( baptisma ) , from English baptism or Portuguese baptismo .
Borrowed from Hindustani बंबई / بَمْبَئی ( bambaī ) , from Portuguese Bombaim .

Definition: stopper, cork, plug, bung; any obstruction in the ear

Etymon pt-PT Note: Borrowed from Urdu کاجُو ( kājū ) , from Portuguese caju .
Borrowed from Hindustani काज / کاج (kāj), from Portuguese casa [de botão].
Definition: work , task , affair & purpose , function & buttonhole

Etymon pt-PT Note: Borrowed from Portuguese (Dalgado); Either through dialectal Classical Persian چا (čā), or directly from Chinese 茶 (chá). Ultimately from Chinese 茶 (chá). Compare Urdu چائے (cā'e) / Hindi चाय (cāy) (Wiktionary)
Borrowed from Hindustani चाबी / چابی ( cābī ) , from Portuguese chave . [ 1 ]
Definition: key Synonym: ਕੁੰਜੀ ( kuñjī ) & spanner , wrench

Etymon pt-PT Note: Borrowed from Hindustani गोभी / گوبھی ( gobhī ) , from Portuguese couve .
Definition: cauliflower Synonym: ਫੁੱਲ ਗੋਭੀ ( phulla gobhī ) & Cruciefrous vegetables like cabbage , cauliflower , kohlrabi , broccoli , Brussels sprout and Chinese cabbage etc.

Etymon pt-PT Note: Borrowed from Hindustani इस्पात / اِسْپات ( ispāt ) , from Portuguese espada .
Borrowed from Urdu گِرْجا ( girjā ) , from Portuguese igreja .
From English Japan , from Portuguese Japão or Dutch Japan , from Malay Jepang , from Hokkien 日本 ( Ji̍t-pún ) , from Middle Chinese 日本 ( nyit pwon X ) .
Borrowed from English monsoon , from Portuguese monção and Dutch moesson , from Arabic مَوْسِم ( mawsim , “ season ” ) . Doublet of ਮੌਸਮ ( mausam ) .
Borrowed from Hindustani तौलिया / تَولِیَہ ( tauliya ) , from Portuguese toalha . [ 1 ]
Pronunciation: IPA ( key ) : /t̪ɔː.ɭi.äː/ , /t̪əu.li.äː/ ( Pakistan ) IPA ( key ) : /t̪oː.lɪ.jə/, Audio ( India ) : ( file ), Rhymes: -äː
Definition: towel ਮੈਨੂੰ ਤੌਲੀਆ ਦੇ ਦਿਓ. ― mainū̃ taulīā de dio. ― Give me the towel. ਮੇਰਾ ਤੌਲੀਆ ਕਿੱਥੇ ਗਿਆ ? ― merā taulīā kitthe giā? ― Where did my towel go?
